Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: Hilary W
Reviews.Content: After reading adverse reviews of this hotel, we were a bit worried that we had booked it. However, we found it to be very suitable for our needs, being very central. Our rooms were well-appointed, and the en-suite bathrooms lovely, with jacuzzi-style baths. The beds were large and comfortable, and maid service was daily. The only down side was the heat in the rooms. We think they must have been over the next-door restaurant's kitchen, as the temperature was very hot, and we couldn't leave the windows open as the mosquitoes would eat us alive! (we got bitten anyway!) We asked one of the receptionists if the air-conditioning was broken, and he told us it was too early to be switched on (April). We asked if we could have an electric fan, and he very obligingly provided one, which helped considerably. The continental breakfast was more than adequate, and the service was excellent. All the staff seemed very friendly, and were very obliging. Other than the heat, we had no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AntonioMayo
Reviews.Content: Great location, good value for the solo traveller. Helpful staff, easy access to P.san Marco, vaporetti, shops etc. Chose hotel on basis of cost alone from a list supplied by airline i booked with. Had read mixed reviews on Tripadvisor so went prepared with this in mind. Would stay there again and hope to do so in the future. I stayed there for nine nights end March beginning April. Easy enough to find given the labryinthine nature of Venetian streets. Co-op supermarket about five minutes from the hotel, if you don't take a wrong turn on the way! Helpful friendly staff in the main. Breakfast and housekeeping staff very friendly. Good efforts made to fix TV in my room. Had a single room, very clean and well appointed with its own ensuite. Location very convenient to have a rest after a day exploring islands before heading out to enjoy Venice at night. Would stay there again and hope to do so in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: acharrison
Reviews.Content: Arrived back today after 8 nights and we wish we hadn't left. I had read the reviews and seen the pictures so I didn't expect much so when we walked in to find a jacuzzi for a bath and a glass chandelier over the bed WOW!! Loved the location half way between the Rialto and San Marco. The staff are lovely, the breakfast lady would have our coffee's ready for us, the receptionist was really concerned when I got sun burnt and the cleaning lady always had the time for us even with the language barrier. Little restaurant downstairs perfectly located for one last drink to take to your room. Would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for such a central location”
Reviews.Author: Peter M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in this hotel. It provided all the facilities that I required: sufficiently comfortable, clean and quiet. It is not at all easy to find, but that is hardly the hotel's fault, since much of Venice (and this area in particular) is a labyrinth of narrow alleyways, and Venetian postal addresses are incomprehensible. Breakfast was nothing to write home about, but that is fairly typical for Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: Callaghans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were travelling round Europe last month and were dreading staying here after all the reviews but I can honestly say it is NOT that bad!!! It was tricky to find though. The reception desk were very friendly and helpful when asked for advice about restaurants. We had paid that little bit extra to get one of the rooms that had their own private bathroom and the room was perfectly suitable for the price and location of it! The one thing I would say about the room though was it was extremely hot due to the pipes that seemed to be running underneath the floor apart from that it was absolutely fine. The thing that let Venice down was Venice itself - bit boring - therefore we left this city early!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, horrible stay.”
Reviews.Author: angelore
Reviews.Content: The location is superb in the heart of venice, that's it. This place is like a mosquito heaven, hot and humid. The room is extremely old and dirty, only shared-bathroom with ppl on your floor. I would not trust the lock on the room door, which is a plastic knob!! The breakfast is all package food. I took the milk from the glass jar to drink and realized that the it was a warm milk, ewwww. Well, you get what you've paid for. horrible place in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hostel, dirty beds and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Chiela v
Reviews.Content: They say they are a hotel, but on the walls they have a certificate for a Â´albergueÂ´ (a hostel). Its hard to find the entrance and there is no elevator. The staff seemed bored and not very helpful. When we accedently removed some sheets we saw that the matrass and sheets were full of pee-stains and went to complain about it. The room was small and very hot, with only a van. The water comes out hot, you have to keep the water running for 10min to make it colder. You share a bathroom with the whole floor, wich wasnÂ´t very clean. The area is noisy and when you open the windows you will go home full of mosquito bites. This is not even worth 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “HOT and LOUD”
Reviews.Author: khoward83
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend staying here. There is no air conditioning. We stayed here in the middle of May when the temp was about 60 in the evening and we still were hot. We couldn't keep the windows open because it was like mosquito heaven. Outside our window across the way was a restaurant which clanged dishes all night long. The location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel turned our dream vacation into a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: NyCiao61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights and could not wait to leave. We were placed in a third floor "attic"room with no air conditioning . It was like a furnace!It had pushbar security door, so when you shut it, it like you were being sealed inside. Not only was the extreme heat a problem, there was a restaurant right below our window-so heard noise and smelled the food. We complained to the front desk clerk-we were told the manager was on leave- it was a health hazard because of the heat. They did nothing! Also, we had a TV that only had a 24 hr sports channel and no fridge. We paid $130.00(US) for each night and the third night-$171! Also, there is no elevator. Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!!! THIS SHOULD BE CALLED CHEATER DI MILANO AND REMOVE FRIM HOTELS ASSOCIATION”
Reviews.Author: Odychua
Reviews.Content: This is not even a hotel.. If I can give it a 0 or negative rating I would..don't be fooled like we were. We booked here for 3 nights at 120 euro per night, when we arrived I have high fever and was grossly disappointed to see a dirty room like sauna with no aircon, my husband told d reception about it but he couldn't care his name is Aladdin and Beatrice, they didn't seem to care whether I die in their hotel so my husband went out at 1 am to look for a decent true hotel and shocked to find a very nice aircon room at just 100 euro, even lower price so we pulled out, receptionist was very rude.. The next day we asked for refund of our 350 euros and they said that it's not their problem that we moved out or that I'm dying from high fever very inconsiderate..I told them that I'm going to blog about my experience but they seem to not care... Pls for your sake don't stay here... They have already fooled a lot of people, there are alot of nicer and cheaper hotels in Venice like d san luca hotel or hotel diana

Reviews.Title: “Almost ruined our stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: R_M_C_Black
Reviews.Content: I guess ill start wit the positives, and this is a very short list. Beatrice, She was outdtanding, che could be described as a shining light in the dark in this holel. in fact, she has to be one of the most helpfull people Ive come accross who is working in hospitality in europe. The only other thing this place has going for it is the location its not even 5 minutes walk from St Marcs Square so super handy for going back to the toilet instead of payning the 1.50 euro to use the publics! The negatives. The rate for a night is the most expensive ive paid accross Europe, and ive had a less enjoyable stay here than in youth hostels, it is not worth what they ask for it. The rooms feel like a sauna, there is no air conditioning but just a fan to push the air around. This can not be classed as airconditioning, it doesnt matter where you come from. The heat in the rooms is in sufferable. The floor is so hot you cant walk on it, its as if they have underfloor heating turned on full, and in the middle of a hot summers day in Venice, it nicer to stand outside in the sun because it to hot in your room. For these first reasons, we asked to change rooms on our first night there, as we got about 2 hours sleep combined, all night!! This is when Beatrice came in, she helped, made sure we had a nicer room with better ventilation, and actually seemed genuinely concerned. The walls are paper thin, and you can hear everthing, and i mean everything going on in the rooms around you! The beds are unconformatable, and when making the booking, we asked for a double bed, but what we got was two singles pushed together, that in it self isnt a bad thing, but, when the beds are of a different height, it just adds to the frustration of trying to sleep. The cold water in the sink in the room we had wouldnt run cold water, the cold side was infact hotter than the hot side so we ended up using bottled water the entire time at great expence to ourselves. this includes brishing our teeth. Ive stayed in plenty of budget accomodation over my time with shared toilets and showers, but this one ahd to be the worst. The showers and toilets were dirty, the floors in the bathrooms had the same issue as the bedrooms, so much so that the staff put towels on the floor to keep the heat off your feet. I had to rig the shower head up so it would stay in one place. They advertise breakfast is included, but you will want to eat something decent as soon as you leave, it wes not a pleasent eating experience. the breakfst staff were pleasent enough, but the food most certainly wasnt. Even when complaining to the managment, all they could say was 'we are aware of the problems, and were sorry' this is un satisfactory. Bottom line is, do not stay here, the few redeeming qualitys this place has are not enough to convince me to ever reccomend it, never stay here, you will regret it for a long, long time.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TheodoreKoulouris
Reviews.Content: I could put up with everything really, but the rudeness of some of the hotel staff was something I'd never witnessed before; the female receptionist - fair hair, blue-eyes (I think), in her late twenties or early thirties perhaps - was one of the rudest people I'd ever dealt with. On the second morning there, I went down to the reception, I bade her good morning - both in Italian and English - only to be greeted with a blank stare; I don't expect to be fawned on, but I do expect a reasonable amount of civility. Thankfully, the rest of the trip - and indeed the rest of the Venetians - made up for the signal rudeness of some of the staff at Citta di Milano.

Reviews.Title: “Budget accomodation in Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: viraam
Reviews.Content: Hotel has the perfect location very near to St marks square. Also if you take a printout of map given on hotel website it is very easy to reach hotel. If you are couple please ask for queen bed otherwise they will give you twin bed room. In my case they changed on request second day. Only the location is good of this hotel rooms are not so big but as it is the budget accomodation it is fine. Also two toilet and one bathroom at one floor. Ventilation in some rooms is not proper but again i would mention venice is very costly and it is a budget accomodation in costly Venice. Only thing which i disliked about thi hotel is the rudeness of breakfast staff. I think staff should be more friendly and also there is a limitated breakfast. Each person will get one crossiant and two bread toast for breakfast. Cornflakes and juice is unlimited.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: BEDBUGS !”
Reviews.Author: histonham
Reviews.Content: The room was adequate but dirty ---- and crawling with bedbugs. Sadly, we didn't realize this until after leaving Venice ( we spent one night only) .We thought the bites were mosquito bites at first, but we soon realized that wasn't the case. My friend and I were covered with bites all over our bodies so there had to be a huge infestation. In addition, we found the front desk very unhelpful around restaurant recommendations, directions, or anything else. You have been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with an Acceptable Level of Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Gade_Siraprapa
Reviews.Content: I only had less than 20 days to plan everything about my 5-days trip (Wed-Mon) at Venice prior to my departure. So, almost every affordable yet beautiful hotels at San Macro were all booked out for Friday and Saturday nights. So, after reading many reviews on the internet, I finally decided to book this hotel with no expectations more than just to find a place to stay at the lowest price in San Macro area to stay during the weekend and stay at another hotels that I desired on the weekdays when their rooms were available. However, this hotel turned out to be beyond my expectations. The hotel location is very great since it is close to go to San Macro so. it's very convenient to do many things e.g. go see the sun rise in the morning at the piazza when there is almost no one there, walk through the area until at late at night and still can find a place to eat, come back to the hotel to take a short break for using toilet and resting my legs for a while when I feel that I cannot walk anymore during the day and easily access to both Rialto port and S. Macro port, etc. So, I think this hotel is perfect for people with limited budget who only want a place to stay in San Marco with an acceptable level of facilities and do not want to stay in the hotel room for no more than just the normal 6-8 sleeping hours. Besides, the hotel staffs are also nice and the hotel location is not that hard to find when you googles the hotel location before you go. You can walk to find this hotel on your own without having to ask anyone. For the cons, the room I stayed was so small that the door panel hits the bed if I open the door wider than 40-60 degrees and there is no elevators. Even though I have no problems with tiny spaces and the large luggage, I still don't like this smallness of the hotel room because you can find a lot larger room with a lot better facilities at a lot cheaper prices at somewhere else in Venice. Moreover, there are no meats, vegetable or eggs in the breakfast menu at all (Almost 95% of the hotel breakfast is CARB w/ tea, juice, milk or coffee) but I was OK with this because I usually do not eat breakfast anyway. So, if the nice, healthy breakfast is the MUST for you, I would suggest you find an additional breakfast meal on your own.

Reviews.Title: “first visit to venice”
Reviews.Author: boysy
Reviews.Content: easy to find walk across san marco square pass the americano coffee shop right ay ferrari shop right by the cartier shop and just beyond small piazza . Very helpful and friendly staff, comfortable rooms, although nothing special, we payed extra for a bathroom ,which we found a bonus , breakfast is the norm rolls and jams, cereal , but enough. Clean towels and bedding every day, and if you want to be in the center of venice , for the price , bang on , try and book week days ,saturday n' sundays are noisy and very busy , we found refuge in the canareggio district which after st. marks was amazing. We will be back soon but will be staying at a cheaper hotel in another district or on luna since its very easy to get from place to place with a water bus pass, loved it , hope you enjoy , we did. guy and ellie, Malta

Reviews.Title: “Superb location but not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RangoonMonsoon
Reviews.Content: If you are simply looking for a relatively cheap place to lay your head in a great location you could do worse than this hotel. Its location is pretty damn good - 2 minutes away from both St. Mark's Square and Rialto Bridge in the thick of the action. The rooms are basic but perfectly comfortable. However, don't expect good service or style. The rooms are fine but the lighting was very dingy, there were no rugs despite the room being cold and there was not much storage space. It all feels slightly knackered, which didn't bother me but those expecting a romantic Venetian palazzo would be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great value !!”
Reviews.Author: theamericandiner
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on a budget and did not expect much but we were delighted with the location the staff were very very helpful the room was large and clean the bed was very comfortable and the sheets were changed daily breakfast was basic but very pleasant indeed all in all 100% i would stay again this hotel does not promise much delivers so much more

Reviews.Title: “Not exciting, great location, nice staff, but more of a youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: andigger
Reviews.Content: I'd have to rate this hotel slightly below average because of the smashed mosquitos on the wall. The staff was friendly, finding the hotel was a bit hard, but anyone who can ask for directions should have no trouble. The incessent mosquitos and the fact they are not cleaned from the walls is what makes me rate this lower. Breakfast was fine, though not exciting. The place really reminds me of a sterotypical youth hostel, though thankfully there was no late night noice problems. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to a friend, but if a friend made a reservation there and then I found out later. I wouldn't encourage them to change locations just be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneTraveller2
Reviews.Content: We were booked in here for one night on 24 August 2010. It is a small budget hotel near St Marks Square. Very difficult to find. We were dismayed to see our room, no working air conditioning and it was 32 degrees. Also, up three flights of stairs and no lift. We requested a room with air conditioning and were told there were none. While sitting in the room wondering what to do, the man on reception phoned and said if we were prepared to pay an extra 30 Euros we could move to another hotel. I walked to the other hotel nearby and asked to see the room. It was much superior, in a better area and with full air conditioning. We moved there straight away and paid the extra money in cash to the other hotel. I think the two hotels are owned by the same company.

Reviews.Title: “Do your homework!”
Reviews.Author: Phillyta
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival found that reserved room didn't have air conditioning (a necessity). Never mentioned when making reservation. However the desk person was very helpful finding us a room with air conditioning at another hotel. Note: When making any recervation, ask for directions. It is very hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice”
Reviews.Author: Ingshki2003
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for the honeymoon and stayed in this hotel...It is quite nice,,,,not the best , of course, cuz its cheaper than the other hotels...For those, who is not so particular,its a comfortable choice,....The Hotel is very close to the San Marco square, the hotel staff is very kind.In a word,,,dont expect much, but if u need to see Venice and not stay in the hotel all day long, then, its a nice choice.

Reviews.Title: “think before you book”
Reviews.Author: parker69
Reviews.Content: trying to rate this hotel and founding it hard to give it 1 star room is more like a hostel. painted yellow with the hint of mozzis crushed on the wall and ceiling only sink in room with a fan to blow all the hot air round. plus points are the staff who are always smileing and helpful and its about 2 min walk to the square. p.s take lots of spending money

Reviews.Title: “Please consider this review before finalizing your stay.”
Reviews.Author: Elanou
Reviews.Content: I consider myself an avid traveler that looks for moderately priced accommodations and I definitely have stayed in old and dirty places around the world. The issue I have with this hotel is the value for your money. It was our most expensive hotel on the trip and it was by far the worst experience I've ever had. First of all, I was convinced we needed to stay close to San Marco, but in reality, Venice is quite small and staying a little further away might save you more money and get you a better place. Second of all, we got the dreaded room 27, which I had read some other reviews and didn't take them that seriously. That room is honestly a furnace. We opened the windows and could feel that it was 5 degrees cooler but it wouldn't carry into the room. In the 3 nights we stayed, I might have slept a total of 10 hours. It is in serious need of renovations. My only piece of advice: please, please think twice before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful”
Reviews.Author: LLPProsper_Tx
Reviews.Content: First of all, the positives: absolutely incredible location, good price, decent breakfast, clean Negative that is a deal breaker: NO AIR...I am from TX and can take the heat, but this was horrible....SAY NO TO ROOM 27..we could not leave the windows open all night because we were on a ledge and anyone could get in...ceiling fan did not work but there was a fan in there...not near enough, so we asked for another....we had to sleep in our underwear with cold towels on...next day, they fixed the ceiling fan but it didn't go fast and THEY TOOK OUR FANS.....we went to get them back and they would only give us one...didn't know where the other one was....finally had to demand it...we truly were suffocating in there. Around 5 a.m. I opened the window and it was a bit better, but this room is like a heatwave....did not care for the man manager at night....not helpful at all...young girl was semi-helpful. Didn't care for the having to leave our key when we went out but all hotels did that in Italy. OVERALL: I would stay in the same location but different hotel. I'm getting sweaty just thinking about this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “There are mosquitos squished on all the walls”
Reviews.Author: shellyse
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have seen in my life. First of all if they give you room 29 just say no right there. The room has no fan, no air conditioning, has no air circulation (the window opens up onto a wall less than 2 feet away) and the floors are heated! This room is an oven and the problem is that if you leave the window open you get a room full of mosquitoes and if you don't open your window you will bake during the night. Luckily they changed our room the next day to one that had a fan. The bathrooms were filthy in both rooms and all of the walls in the the rooms and hallways were covered with marks from people killing bugs on them. The girl night clerk (we didn't catch her name) whose boyfriend was there flirting with her the whole time wanted to take our key when we left the hotel (we refused) and the hotel gets locked up and the clerk goes upstairs to sleep after midnight. 2 stars??? I think not. I think it's even a stretch to give them one star...yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: wydd
Reviews.Content: It's a very simple hotel but clean, confortable hotel but with an excellent location very close to Piazza di San Marco (the "top" place in Venice), by a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located little Gem of a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jabu55
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights over the Easter weekend of 2010 in this great little hotel with some friends and had a lovely weekend. The hotel is just a few hundred metres from Piazza San Marco but as others have commented a bit difficult to find the front door! Head inland through the bell tower and find the black-fronted Cartier jewellery shop. Head down the alley on the right of Cartiers and you will come to a square with a restaurant ahead of you. The hotel is above the restaurant. To get to the front door you will need to go down the alley to the right of the restaurant and hang a sharp left through the walkway under the building behind the restaurant - front door to the hotel is in the corner on your left as you exit the underpass. This is a clean well run little hotel with friendly helpful staff. The rooms are fairly basic but quite adequate and nicely decorated. Ours was on the 2nd floor with shower, comfortable double bed, TV, fan and light dimmer. There have been some comments about noise and mosquitos. Well here's the thing; in a lively, vibrant city with lots of water all around, what do you expect? Only noise we had was the chatter of people enjoying themselves in the restaurant until around 11pm and the odd mosquito, so get some repellant if that's going to be a problem. The restaurant below is also excellent with friendly efficient service and a meal and drinks averaged out at about 80% of what we would have paid at home. Highly recommended and if ever we go back to Venice this will be our first choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great location, Hard to find”
Reviews.Author: manorpark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend, as others have said it is hard to find so read some of the tips on here to locate it. As it was a 2 star hotel i did not expect the earth but we had a good sized room on the third floor with private bathroom, there is no lift and the stairs take there toll when you have luggage. the room was fairly basic and the TV had no English channels but we did not come to Venice to sit in our room or watch TV. If you like a coffee in the morning take a kettle as there is none in the room, the breakfast is basic as stated in other reviews but the coffee is good. The alleyway/street outside our room was quiet noisy at night as the cobblestones and high building seems to make everything echo upwards, voices, footsteps etc. It did not bother us too much but may annoy some. What was great about this hotel is the central location with only a short walk taking you to either the Rialto area or St. Marks. So if you only have a weekend there as we did it meant we had no travelling time or costs to get to the main tourist sites and we were able to make the most of the time we had available. Overall I was pleased with this hotel as it met our needs for this type of trip (short city visit) although if I was there for a week or more I would look to book a hotel with more facilities as you would be spending more time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Mythicalsoul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my same sex partner for 2 nights in room 30, which had a view out to one of the small squares. It was a basic room with shared bathroom. There is a sink and mirror in the room though, and a fan for the hot days. The bed was extremely uncomfortable, as it was two beds pushed together that kept coming apart. It is normal to have two beds to make a larger one, but they kept moving and led to an uncomfortable nights sleep. On our floor there were two bathrooms, one with just a toilet (very small), and the other with a shower and a toilet. The shower was extremely small as well, and the bathroom got soaked with every shower. The location was amazing, as it was a hop skip and jump to St. Mark's Square. The breakfast room was nice, although the service wasn't the best. Basic food, see pictures for more. Overall, I would recommend this for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS OVERPRICED DUMP A YOUTH HOSTEL WOULD BE BETTER”
Reviews.Author: tenleagueboots
Reviews.Content: Having travelled extensively throughout the world this is the worst place I have ever stayed in. Impossible to have a shower in our room without getting scorched as hardly any cold water.I was met with casual indifference when I complained about this.On our third and last night no cold water at all. When the hotelier eventually came to check it out he said ''you can't shower with this'' and I was told to use the shared shower down the hall. This is way overpriced even for Venice. One good thing is the location, but very difficult to find the first time with map from hotel site which led us on a dog leg.We were however able to find a quicker and more direct route straight across the square. Stairs to climb with luggage can handle that,basic continental breakfast fine.Dingey rooms were told to keep windows shut in our upstairs room to prevent cats coming in .This place spoilt an otherwise wonderful experience in Venice. You would only stay here if you were desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, unless you like staying in a dump.”
Reviews.Author: artdav
Reviews.Content: This is positively the worst hotel I have stayed in since the remotest areas of Tibet! I had booked for one night, with my family of four in an adjacent room. We paid Â£360 for these rooms and they were at the very top of the building............third floor and no lift so with very heavy bags (as we were going on a cruise the following day) it was most inconvenient pulling these up. The rooms are one star by any standards. The beds were just about O.K. but the pillows the worst I have encountered and nearly two weeks later I still have severe neck-ache. as do my son and daugfhter-in-law! The televisions are 20 years old at least and had NO English programmes at all. Mosquitoes were everywhere and I have never been so badly bitten (and I have travelled all over the world including many times in Africa!!). The breakfast was extremely basic and about the only redeeming factor about the whole experience was the position of this 'very-hard-to-find' building which is equidistant from St Mark's Square and the Rialto bridge. I would also say that the reception staff were very helpful in getting us a water taxi nearby when we departed. I am very angry at having to pay so much for such a rubbish hotel and could not in any circumstances recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, large room, but difficult hotel to find”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Blackadder
Reviews.Content: The first time it took me 70 minutes off the Rialto to find this hotel. It is a 4 minute walk. it is also 5 minutes from san marco If you can locate the Cartier shop (it is black glass) on Campo San Zulian (you can ask directions), you are now 1 minute away. Then turn left by the church in front of you, left agian behind the cartier shop), turn right follow calle round and you need to go under a low archway on your left. I will stay here again, excellent location , very helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBenedetto
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay in this hotel. The staff were wonderful and courteous. I had the pleasant experience of seeing Andrea Bocelli in concert at this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again on my future visit. It is situated in a great area and you are able to walk anywhere from this location. It has everything that you need for a hotel for your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Is exactly what it says it is”
Reviews.Author: Malfie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to stay at this hotel whilst in Venice. We were travelling around Italy for two weeks and started the tour with three nights in Venice. Whilst there we would be celebrating our first year of marriage. This hotel is exactly what it claims to be. It is very cheap accommodation for very basic accommodation needs - it's for people who want to see Venice and aren't bothered about having a posh hotel room because they're not planning on spending a lot of time in the room anyway. I personally think that the for the price and value for money this hotel was actually better than I expected it to be. The first great thing about this hotel is the location. It is literally a couple of minutes walk to St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge, two of Venice's biggest attractions. Most hotels near here are priced significantly higher than this one so it really is a bargain with Venice's hotspots right on your doorstep. We arrived to the hotel and checked in quickly and efficiently. One downside is that our room was on the top floor - up three large flights of stairs and there was no lift so this was a bit of a struggle with suitcases so this may not be the best option for disabled people or those not in the best of health but we found it fine (once we had our suitcases up after the first day) and joked it burnt off all the calories we ate for dinner! We had booked a double room with a private bathroom but I know this hotel also has shared rooms with shared bathrooms though this wan't for us! Our room was not decorated very nicely admittedly - a little dark and old fashioned BUT it was very large, very clean, had TWO balonettes, a TV and the bathroom was clean as well. A maid came daily to replace the sheets and empty bins etc and we had no problems at all. The room, when we visited in June 2009 DID have air conditioning also and this was great because one night we left the windows open and the mosquitos got us bad so it was a blessing. I know other reviewers have said there was no air con but they must have listened and installed it because ours was fine and worked okay. Breakfast admittedly wasn't the best, offering only a croissant, bread roll or one type of cereal with organge juice or coffee BUT it wasn't terrible and bette than not having anything available for breakfast. It was adequate and suited the price of the hotel. Finally, the staff at this hotel were wonderful. We had the same lady who dealt with breakfast every day and she was polite and willing to please. The two men we encountered on reception (one old and one young - older man in the evenings, younger man through the day) were both very polite, frindly, welcoming and willing to help. They were great at heloing with directions and the older man even helped us with our anniversay meal. We asked him for a recommended restaurant that was not ridiculously expensive but near the Grand Canal as we wanted to watch the Canal as we ate. He even went to thr trouble of searching the net and left menus, directions and maps with the other man on the next shift to pass to us next time he seen us! We ended up having a lovely meal at a restauant at the foot of the Rialto Bridge overlooking the Grand Canal which was exactly what we wanted! Thank you so much o this hotel and its staff for making our stay wonderful and I would redcommend this hotel to ANYONE that wants to be near all the ation in Venice, in a cheap, budget, basic but CLEAN and ADEQUATE hotel.

Reviews.Title: “central location, expensive for what they offer”
Reviews.Author: vayio
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is great, only 5 mins walk from San Marco and Riarto, although a bit difficult to find it. (I found it following specific instructions from other traveler reviews). Venice is trully in your feet. Hotel is vey old, rooms are very small, although clean enough. The worst thing was a bad smell coming from the nearby osteria, all the night. I could hardly breathe fresh air. Breakfast is continental buffet, not many foods (cerial, bread, croissants), but you can eat as much as you want, which is good. They also make cappuccino and espresso. Price is a bit high for what they offer, but I think that is one of the most cheapest hotels around San Marco (Venice's central hotels are very very expensive). But beeing in Venice means that you expect high prices for everything. Also I prefer staying in Venice's center, instead of a cheaper and better hotel somewhere isolated in Venice's labyrinth (Anyone could easily get lost especially at night).

Reviews.Title: “Basic, central accommodations”
Reviews.Author: LateTraveler11
Reviews.Content: Puzzled at some of the other reviews; it's as if we're discussing two different properties. Citta di Milano is pretty basic, but has a great location, is clean, and we found the breakfast perfectly adequate--not hearty, but well beyond minimal Continental standard--and the breakfast room is actually staffed by a pleasant woman who makes coffee to order. Our room had a full bathroom included, as well as two windows overlooking a street that provided glimpses of everyday life at all hours. No smells, and the phone did work. The hotel IS extremely difficult to find without stopping for further directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: GraceIreland
Reviews.Content: I was very uncertain about booking this hotel based on some of the reviews that I had read, but it worked out brilliantly. First of all, it's a simple hotel, so don't expect the Ritz. But, if you want a cheap place to stay, 2 mins from St Marks Square, clean, this is perfect. I paid â‚¬60 per night for a room which was basic, but clean, with a sink, crisp sheets...the bathroom and toilet were down the corridor but I never had any problems in accessing them or sharing them with other guests. Breakfast was simple - not quite posh enough to call continental - but enough to get you going in the morning. Location was perfect, and price amazing, considering this was Carnevale week. I would recommend it, but set your personal expectations before you arrive because it's not 4 or 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amber665
Reviews.Content: This is a small, low budget hotel right in the centre of Venice, 2min from St Marks & 5min from Rialto. It is very clean and the staff are friendly & helpful. The hotel is a bit difficult to find as it is in a small street off a square, but any of the local shops & bars will help you find it. The room was a good size & had a large single bed, the ensuite bathroom was a bit cramped but the shower was good & there was enough hot water. Not all the rooms are ensuite, but there was a good sized shower & bathroom & separate toilet for those sharing. The hotel was very popular with young people as well as families from a variety of different countries. The breakfast was simple, but had a range of cereals as well as sweet & savoury breads & pastries. Out of season, this hotel is exceptional value for money for it's facilities and location.

Reviews.Title: “DUMP”
Reviews.Author: blotski71
Reviews.Content: This hotel IS the worse that we have ever expieranced. A room that at best can be described as sparce. With the most horrendous stench of foul drains that without open windows made us sick. The "breakfast" consists of a converted bedroom, used to serve one type of cereal,a croissant and not alot else. The room door could be blown open by a 4 yr old. The shower was luke warm at very best and we had the sound of flushing toilets through our room every time another guest flushed their toilet. The basin in the bathroom was cracked, this had happened by something falling off the loose shelf above it prior to us going. Also the plug did not work. We were aware that this was a budget hotel , with a two star rating. From our stay i would recommend that nobody use this hotel, as we are shocked that the travel agent even considered using this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Left out in the cold!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KJLovey
Reviews.Content: I knew that our flight times would mean that we wouldnt be on venice Island until atleast 11.30 - 12 midnight so I called our contact at needahotel to check if this would be problem and was assured the hotel were aware and everything would be ok! Unfortunately there was a delay at the airport, due to hand luggage restrictions, which meant we got to the Rialto at 12.45. After finding the hotel, approx 1am, there was no one available to let us in! The lights were on but nobody home!! We rang the doorbell constantly...even the next door neighbour came to their door! Rang the hotels phone, atleast 5 times and tried the emergency number...no luck!! So what do you do at 1.30am in a strange city!!!?? We managed to find a nice hotel called the 'Panada' that although they only had a single bed available were very accomodating. In the morning we headed over to the hotel to confront the manager, Mr Alviso, who was very unhelpful and unsympathetic. He showed us our room but after all the hassle I had had with this man and his 'so called hotel' I wasnt prepared to stay there. So we headed back to the Panada where we were offered a double bed and put the experiences of the previous night behind us to enjoy this beautiful city. I am currently dealing with needahotel over my complaint but Mr Alviso is adamant that he did everything he could to assit us!! He explanaition that his night porter had gone home doesnt wash! He says that he tried to get to the door!! I doubt it! I was confused because they take your keys off of you before you leave the hotel, so no partying past midnight in this hotel! I have asked for a refund of the night missed in the hotel and the additional 100 euros I incurred in the Panada, as a fair settlement to this fiasco....the story continues!! In conclusion, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone and wont be offering to buy Mr Alviso a bellini anytime soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: bretami
Reviews.Content: There is much better value for your money in Venice while affording you the same location (which is the ONLY thing this property has going for it). We had originally booked 3 nights here from May 6-9, but checked out immediately. When we arrived after a long day of travel we walked into our narrow, dark room to find two twin beds, walls that hadn't been painted or cleaned in years, and a sink. It was like a cell. When I took off to find the bathroom, there were only two toilet down the hall (most times I checked at least one of which was occupied because the whole floor of say 12 rooms, had access to them). When I inquired at the front desk as to the showers, the desk attendant replied that they weren't "open" and that I could use them come morning. He would not be very specific, but said they tend to open them between 7am-11am. At that point I knew that we couldn't stay here. Luckily, we were able to check out with only 1 night penalty (way too much for what could ONLY be described as a hostel). The good news is that we stayed at Residenza Ca' San Marco due to some quick investigation on the Internet and a last minute cancellation. This property was only around the corner -- still same great location between San Marco and the Rialto bridge, but a PALACE in comparson. We paid 20 more Euros a night for a superbly decorated room, updated private bath, great location and a superb, English-speaking staff. Please see my review and pictures under Residenza Ca' San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: sunshiner
Reviews.Content: Great location so close to St Marks. Very difficult to find, need to ask the local shop owners how to find it. Room on first floor very small. No chest of drawers, few hangers in the small wardrobe. Bathroom small, tiles needed cleaning between. Clean towels everyday. Children on 4th floor much bigger room, huge bathroom. Superb view down into the alleyway below. Breakfast room small and airless, very basic breakfast but enough. room to keep luggage in. No lift a real pain. No offer of help with taking cases to rooms. Very basic but superb position. supermarket nearby useful.

Reviews.Title: “No romance in Venice”
Reviews.Author: travel_addict_here
Reviews.Content: While the room was very clean, 2 narrow twin beds and a toilet down the hall do NOT make for a romantic getaway. The skeeters were extremely persistent. And personally I hate sharing a tiny shower with some very sloppy fellow guests. It would be fine for students/backpackers or adventuresome types; I wouldn't recommend it for 2 middleaged people with aches and pains hoping for a second honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I Was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at the hotel.It was not a bad as I thought it might be.Yes it was basic but it was clean and comfortable and in a great location.The intimate breakfast room provided you with a more than adequate continental breakfast and the restaurant at the front of the hotel was very good we went every night and the prices were fair as it was in a city. Do not under estimate the mozzies they will get you so take plenty of sprays and lotions etc. As someone else has mentioned find the Cartier shop behind St Marks Square and you are sure to find the hotel . We got what we paid for and would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Live-4-Hols-UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is better described as a hostel, very basic however our room was clean as were the corridoors. We had no air conditioning although the fan supplied was a help. The shared bathroom we used needs some attention but was OK and cleaned regularly. You cannot fault the location, central to every thing. By British standards the hotel is expensive but by venice standards is at the cheaper end of the market. If the quality of your hotel is important to you don't use this one, if you want a clean, well located, very very basic hotel then this OK and not too expensive. Could be hard to find but we found it first time thanks to the advice on trip advisor regarding the cartier shop!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the mosquitos”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Citta di Milano near San Marco in May 05. Just the job. If you need a wee whilst in St Marks, it's near enough to go back to. Not too expensive. Clean. Adequate breakfast. Nice view from bedroom and from toilet! Friendly staff. no lift but that did'nt bother me. To find, walk from St Marks towards Rialto and when you arrive at the Cartier shop, keep right into a little square where there is a restaurant. The hotel is above the restaurant. Keep right down the side of the restaurant and then left under a tunnel. Hotel entrance on the left. Mossies bothered us in the night.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Citta di Milano
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco, 590 | Campiello S. Zulian, 30124 Venice, Italy
